During the Soviet years 1964–1989, the town was renamed to Varduva. At that time, people, who visited this place as pilgrims, were persecuted by KGB. Only in 1989 the town's name was restored back to its historic name Žemaičių Kalvarija.
This is a very small town, hence there's no public transport. You can walk, ride a bike or drive.
